product_owner.title: Product Owner
product_owner.description: This key contains the full name of one of the product owner. It must be a real person.

ministry.title: Ministry
ministry.description: This key contains the ministry name. link: https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/organizational-structure/ministries-organizations/ministries

enum: Energy, Mines and Low Carbon Innovation

program_area.title: Program Area
program_area.description: This key contains the program area name. ex: It could be a ministry division branch or section.

application_acronym.title: Application Acronym
application_acronym.description: This key contains the application acronym. ex: Infrastructure reporting service the acronym (IRS)

application_name.title: Application Name
application_name.description: This key contains the full application name.

business_capabilities_standard.title: Business Capabilities Standard
business_capabilities_standard.description: This key contains the business capabilities that are supported by this application. ex: Invoice Management, Customer Relationship Management, Supply Chain Management.

business_capabilities_custom.title: Business Capabilities Custom
business_capabilities_custom.description: This key contains the business capabilities that are supported by this application, which are not available in pick list of `business_capabilities_standard`. Array of string with free text

application_short_description.title: Application Short Description
application_short_description.description: This key contains a short description of the software. It should be a single line containing a single sentence. Maximum 150 characters are allowed.

application_long_description.title: Application Long Description
application_long_description.description:
This key contains a longer description of the software, between 500 and 10000 chars. It is meant to provide an overview of the capabilities of the software for a potential user. The audience for this text should be that of users of the software, not developers. You can think of this text as the description of the software that would be in its website (if the software had one).

This description can contain some basic markdown: *italic*, **bold**, bullet points and [links](#).

product_status.title: Product Status
product_status.description: Status of the product. more around this can be found here https://github.com/bcgov/repomountie/blob/master/doc/lifecycle-badges.md

hosting_platforms.title: Hosting Platforms
hosting_platforms.description: This key contains the hosting platforms used in this product.

relational_datastore.title: Relational Datastore
relational_datastore.description: This key contains the relational databases used. The main engine behind the relation databases, for ex: cockroach DB uses postgresql, patroni is a distributed flavor of postgresql

non_relational_datastore.title: Non Relational Datastore
non_relational_datastore.description: This key contains the non-relational databases used.

backend_languages_version.title: Backend Languages with their version.
backend_languages_version.description: This key contains the languages used for backends( java or erlang or golang or elixir or rust etc..) with their version

backend_frameworks.title: Backend Frameworks.
backend_frameworks.description: This key contains the frameworks used for backends( express or gin or fiber or spring boot or quarkus etc..).

frontend_languages.title: Frontend Languages.
frontend_languages.description: This key contains the frontend languages.

frontend_frameworks.title: Frontend Frameworks.
frontend_frameworks.description: This key contains the frontend frameworks(react or angular or vue et..)

spatial_storage_platform.title: Spatial Storage Platform.
spatial_storage_platform.description: This key contains the spatial storage platforms used in the stack.

spatial_mapping_technologies.title: Spatial Mapping Technologies
spatial_mapping_technologies.description: This key contains the mapping technologies used in the stack(Leaflet, Geoserver  et..)

identity_authorization.title: Identity And Authorization
identity_authorization.description: This key contains the Identity Integrations and authorization components used in the stack.

notification_standard.title: Notification Standard.
notification_standard.description: This key contains the notification systems use.

notification_custom.title: Notification Custom.
notification_custom.description: This key contains the notification other which is to be filled if the notification does not have the option to fill in.

data_custodian.title: Data Custodian.
data_custodian.description: This key contains the Contact Name who is data custodian for the application/suite of applications.link https://bcgov.github.io/data-publication/pages/dsg_bcdc_roles_responsibilities.html#am-i-a-data-custodian

data_steward.title: Data Steward.
data_steward.description: This key contains the Contact Name who is the data steward.

data_manager.title: Data Manager.
data_manager.description: This key contains the Contact Name who is the data manager.

description: bcgovpubcode.yml is a metadata standard for repositories containing software developed or acquired by the Public Administration, aimed at making them easily discoverable and thus reusable by other entities.

product_information.title: Product Information.
product_information.description: This Section describes the basic information around product.

product_technology_information.title: Product Technology Information.
product_technology_information.description: This Section describes the basic information around tech stack used in the product.

product_external_dependencies.title: Product External Dependencies.
product_external_dependencies.description: This Section describes the information around external dependencies which the product relies upon.

data_management_roles.title: Data Management Roles.
data_management_roles.description: This Section describes the information around Data Assets.

bcgov_pubcode_version.title: BCGov Pubcode Version.
bcgov_pubcode_version.description: This key defines which version of the yaml is being filled.
